method.name: GET

doc.title: Initiate an OAuth response type flow

method.doc: Initializes an OAuth 2.0 flow using a response_type. See RFC 6749 for more details

request.doc: Initiates the OAuth 2.0 flow using a response_type. The API validates the incoming request and redirects to /authorize/login.

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]: used with response_type 'code'
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered mobile device. A mobile client is identified as such if the registered SCOPE includes 'msso'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: 'client_id' of the requesting client.

param.name: response_type
param.doc: MUST be 'code' or 'token' or 'token id_token'
'token id_token' is only supported in conjunction with scope=openid

param.name: redirect_uri
param.doc: A 'redirect_uri' that was registered for this client. It is required if multiple redirect_uri's have been registered for this client.

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

param.name: nonce
param.doc: This is required for response_type 'token id_token'.

param.name: display
param.doc: This is optional and used within the context of OpenID Connect. This parameter is not used here but forwarded to the /authorize/login API. Currently only 'page', 'social_login' (MAG only) an 'local' (MAG only) are supported by default.
[MAG]: the value 'social_login' will create a JSON message response instead of an HTML page containing a list of social login providers.
[MAG]: the value 'local' will prevent the authorization server from displaying the social login buttons. This is the case if a user selected the local enterprise button for logging in.

param.name: prompt
param.doc: This is used within the context of OpenID Connect. Indicates whether the server should prompt for login/consent. It is a space separated list of different values. The server supports the values 'none', 'login' 'consent'. 'prompt=none' is only respected if 'id_token_hint' is not empty. For consent is only respected if the current user has an active oauth session using the same client and the same SCOPE.

param.name: id_token_hint
param.doc: This is used within the context of OpenID Connect. Contains a previously issued id_token. This parameter is only respected for 'prompt=none' or 'prompt=none consent'.

param.name: acr_values
param.doc: This is used within the context of OpenID Connect. Indicates which acr classes are acceptable for the user authentication. It is a space separated list of different values.

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

response.doc: A success response including the redirect location header to the server that handles the login.
The parameter 'sessionData''s structure looks as this:

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) includes these required parameters: action=(display or login depending on 'prompt' and 'id_token_hint') & sessionID & sessionData (a JWT containing a JSON message holding session data)

response.doc: If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: error_description
param.default: The given mag-identifier is either invalid or points to an unknown device

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

response.doc: If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: error_description
param.default: The referenced device is not activated

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

response.doc: If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: error_description
param.default: No registered scope value for this client has been requested

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

response.doc: If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: error_description
param.default: None of the supported response_types were used

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

response.doc: If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: error_description
param.default: The client lacks authorization for this request

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: Missing or duplicate parameters

error: invalid_redirect_uri
error_description: Mismatching redirect_uri. Given: the-given-redirect-uri

error: invalid_request
error_description: The client type is not valid

response.doc: The client could not be authenticated.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: The given client credentials were not valid

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

representation.doc:
error: server_error
error_description: The request failed due to an unknown reason

}

method.name: GET
method.doc: Receives a request as the result of a redirect from /auth/oauth/v2/authorize. Creates the login page or forward to the consent screen.

request.doc: Use these parameters for a default implementation: 'sessionID=some-session-value', 'action=display', 'sessionData=some-session-data'.

param.name: sessionID
param.doc: The current session which was initiated at the initial authorization request.

param.name: sessionData
param.doc: A signed JWT which contains a JSON structure holding values initially received and validated at /authorize.

response.doc: An HTML page displaying the login screen.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: Missing or duplicate parameters

}

response.doc: The session has expired or already been granted.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: The session has expired or already been granted. The login process has to be repeated to be successful

}

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

representation.doc:
error: server_error
error_description: The request failed due to an unknown reason

method.name: POST
method.doc: Authenticates a user during the OAuth 2.0 response_type flow.

request.doc: Use these parameters for a default implementation: 'sessionID=some-session-value', 'action=login', 'sessionData=some-session-data'.

param.name: sessionID
param.doc: The current session which was initiated at the initial authorization request.

param.name: sessionData
param.doc: A signed JWT which contains a JSON structure holding values initially received at /authorize.
If the sessionData value 'prompt=none' and username/password are not provided as additional values then 'id_token_hint' is used (if it is available) to authenticate the user.

param.name: username
param.doc: The username of the user to be authenticated. Has to be provided with 'password'. It is optional if the initial request was made to support 'id_token_hint'.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password of the user to be authenticated. Has to be provided with 'username'. It is optional if the initial request was made to support 'id_token_hint'.

response.doc: If authentication was successful the API auto-form posts to the API that handles the consent screen, /authorize/consent

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: Missing or duplicate parameters

}

response.doc: The session has expired or already been granted.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: The session has expired or already been granted. The login process has to be repeated to be successful

}

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated. An HTML page displaying an authentication error will be returned.

representation.doc:
error: authentication_error
error_description: The resource owner could not be authenticated due to missing or invalid credentials

}

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

representation.doc:
error: server_error
error_description: The request failed due to an unknown reason

method.name: POST
method.doc: Authenticates a user during the OAuth 2.0 response_type using a social platform.

request.doc: This method handles login via a social login provider.

param.name: state
param.doc: The state representing the session (state is used instead of sessionID). This was attached to the initial request to the social login provider.

param.name: code
param.doc: An OAuth 2.0 authorization_code issued by a social login provider.

param.name: provider
param.doc: The social login provider that issued the 'code'. This value is specified as part of the redirect_uri configured with each social login provider.

param.name: oauth_token
param.doc: OAuth 1.0 token when the social login provider is used with OAuth 1.0.

param.name: oauth_verifier
param.doc: OAuth 1.0 verifier when the social login provider is used with OAuth 1.0.

response.doc: If authentication was successful the API auto-form posts to the API that handles the consent screen, /authorize/consent
If the redirect_uri is not available, the server displays an HTML page showing the error and error_description. The HTTP status will be '400'

param.name: location
param.doc: Location (URL) has the 'error', 'error_description' and 'state' (if provided) parameter attached.

param.name: state
param.doc: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: Missing or duplicate parameters

}

response.doc: The session has expired or already been granted.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: The session has expired or already been granted. The login process has to be repeated to be successful

}

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated. An HTML page displaying an authentication error will be returned.

representation.doc:
error: authentication_error
error_description: The resource owner could not be authenticated due to missing or invalid credentials

}

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

representation.doc:
error: server_error
error_description: The request failed due to an unknown reason

method.doc: Authenticates a user during the OAuth 2.0 response_type flow.

request.doc: The consent page display's the wrong username. This API creates a page with instructions for the user to authenticate again.

response.doc: An HTML page displaying a message with instructions on what to do next.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Handles the 'grant' result of a resource owners decision at the consent page.

request.doc: The API returns and HTML page for the user to grant or deny the request.

param.name: sessionData
param.doc: The signed and encrypted JWT containing session data.

response.doc: Response for the 'authorization_code' flow. Redirect back to the client after a successful authentication.

param.name: Location
param.doc: The 'redirect_uri' to the client that will receive the result of this request including parameters 'code' and 'state' (state only if it was provided by the client.

response.doc: Response for the 'implicit' flow. Redirect back to the client after a successful authentication.

param.name: Location
param.doc: The 'redirect_uri' to the client that will receive the result of this request including parameters within a URL fragment. The parameters are these:
'access_token': The issued access_token. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'expires_in': The access_token lifetime in seconds. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'token_type': The token type. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'scope': The granted SCOPE which may differ from the requested ones. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'id_token': The id_token (represented as JWT) which will be issued for response_type 'token id_token' if the requested SCOPE included 'openid'. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'id_token_type': The type of id_token. This is a OTK extension to allow the creation of other types, e.g.: SAML. This parameter is part of the URL fragment.
'state': Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: Missing or duplicate parameters

}

response.doc: The session has expired or already been granted.

representation.doc:
error: invalid_request
error_description: The session has expired or already been granted. The login process has to be repeated to be successful

}

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated. An HTML page displaying an authentication error will be returned.

representation.doc:
error: authentication_error
error_description: The resource owner could not be authenticated due to missing or invalid credentials

}

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

representation.doc:
error: server_error
error_description: The request failed due to an unknown reason

}

param.name: error_description
param.default: The resource_owner denied access to resources

param.name: state

}

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token, refresh_token using OAuth 2.0 grant_type=password. See RFC 6749 for more details

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'password'

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
[MAG]: This response includes an id_token and id_token_type if the requested SCOPE included 'msso'.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token, refresh_token using OAuth 2.0 grant_type=authorization_code. See RFC 6749 for more details.

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'authorization_code'

param.name: code
param.doc: The authorization_code that was requested using the 'response_type=code' flow.

param.name: redirect_uri
param.doc: A 'redirect_uri' that was registered for this client. If used during the initial code request, it is required and must match the original value.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
This response gets returned if the request included SCOPE=openid.
The given grant has expired or is invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
An unauthorized client is using the code.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token using OAuth 2.0 grant_type=refresh_token. See RFC 6749 for more details

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'refresh_token'

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only the SCOPE values or a subset of those values originally requested will be granted.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
The given grant has expired or is invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
An unauthorized client is using the code.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The given token is not valid, it is disabled
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token using the OAuth 2.0 grant_type=client_credentials. See RFC 6749 for more details

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'client_credentials'

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token using the OAuth 2.0 extension grant_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer'.

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

param.name: assertion
param.doc: This parameter MUST contain an id_token (represented as JWT) that represents an authenticated resource owner.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
An unauthorized client is using the code.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Request access_token using the OAuth 2.0 extension grant_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:saml2-bearer

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]
[MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device. This grant_type, however, is not supported by MAG

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). This can only be used INSTEAD of the parameters 'client_id', 'client_secret'.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: client_secret
param.doc: The client_secret. This can only be used INSTEAD of using the authorization header.

param.name: grant_type
param.doc: MUST be set to 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:saml2-bearer'.

param.name: scope
param.doc: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

param.name: assertion
param.doc: This parameter must contain a base64 encoded SAML token that represents an authenticated resource owner.

response.doc: The access_token can be used to access protected resources. The refresh_token can be exchanged for an access_token and a new refresh_token.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The resource owner could not be authenticated
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Revoke an access_token or refresh_token. See RFC 7009 for more details. Section 2.3 of that RFC is not supported.

request.doc: The token can only be revoked by the client that initially requested and received it! This API returns a success response even if the given token does not exist or has already been revoked.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)). For public clients, the client_secret is not required.

param.name: token
param.doc: The token as it was issued.

param.name: token_type_hint
param.doc: Valid values are 'access_token' and 'refresh_token'.

response.doc: The token was successfully revoked or it was invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: GET
method.doc: The endpoint returns details about a registered OAuth client.

request.doc: This endpoint is disabled by default. If requests fail due to an unknown endpoint, contact the system administrator.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing resource_owner credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(username:password)). Depending on the server configuration this header may not be required.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client_id for which details are requested.

response.doc: A JSON message including details about a client in order to configure it. The client_secret may or may not be included depending on the OAuth server configuration.
The JSON message will also include the public certificate of the OAuth server as PEM.

representation.doc: { "server": { "hostname": "example.ca.com", "port": 9443, "prefix": "/urlprefix", "server_certs": [ [ "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----", "MIIC/...ybEYFkq", "BLQ=", "-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ] ] }, "oauth": { "client": { "organization": "CA Technologies", "description": "Example application for Mobile SSO Demo", "client_name": "AppA", "client_type": "confidential", "registered_by": "John Doe", "client_ids": [ { "client_id": "84695 ... b39770c3d", "client_secret": "abcde ... ldjjakkC", "scope": "openid email profile", "redirect_uri": "https://example.com/client/consent?state=23n23n...13k1j4", "environment": "ALL", "status": "ENABLED", "registered_by": "John Doe" } ] }, "system_endpoints": { "authorization_endpoint_path": "/auth/oauth/v2/authorize", "token_endpoint_path": "/auth/oauth/v2/token", "token_revocation_endpoint_path": "/auth/oauth/v2/token/revoke", "usersession_logout_endpoint_path": "/connect/session/logout" }, "oauth_protected_endpoints": { "userinfo_endpoint_path": "/openid/connect/v1/userinfo", "usersession_status_endpoint_path": "/connect/session/status" } }, "custom": { "mag_demo_products_endpoint_path": "/protected/resource/products", "oauth_demo_protected_api_endpoint_path": "/oauth/v2/protectedapi/foo" } }

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
If the server cert to be exported has not been configured correctly.
The resource owner could not be authenticated

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 and will contain the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: GET
method.doc: The client requests the session status by passing in the id_token of the authenticated user.

request.doc: This informs the client if the resource owner is logged in and has a valid session. The session may be active or not existing.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: A valid access_token (e.g.: authorization: Bearer access-token-value)

param.name: id_token
param.doc: The id_token of the resource owner

param.name: id_token_type
param.doc: The id_token_type to be invalidated. Required if not default type.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The given token is not valid. The error code may be 1003990, 1003991, 1003992, 1003993
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: POST
method.doc: The resource owner deletes his active session on the OAuth server.

param.name: mag-identifier
param.doc: [MAG]: mobile clients MUST use this header. It must represent a valid registered device.

param.name: logout_apps
param.doc: [MAG]: mobile clients MAY use this parameter to invalidate all related oauth token.

param.name: authorization
param.doc: The HTTP basic authorization header containing the client credentials as base64 encoded string (authorization: Basic base64(client_id:client_secret)).

param.name: id_token
param.doc: The id_token that represents the authenticated user.
[MAG]: Mobile clients may omit this parameter; mag-identifier will be used instead.

param.name: id_token_type
param.doc: The id_token_type to be invalidated. Currently ignored.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The client could not be authenticated.

param.name: WWW-Authenticate
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 7235 if an authentication scheme has been used. It contains the used authentication scheme and an error message.

response.doc: The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.
